author: ghosts_in_the_code
content:
Yeah there are differences, ethereum proof of custody for validators does seem better than arweave asking "recall blocks" from miners. But in either system I dont think validators or miners is the constraint, both are being paid a ton of money (via block reward) and can afford as many SSDs as needed if you pay enough.

Constraint imo is nodes outside of the validators or miners being able to verify and transmit data, and in Arweave they have nodes paying each other (outside of consensus) instead of pure altrusim.
